intro: Heuchera longipetala var. orizabensis, commonly known as the Orizaba heuchera, is a perennial plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant foliage, which ranges from deep red to purple and green. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
